snippet: Worried that her teenage son was slipping into drug addiction, Tawana Gilbert created a financial hardship for her family by leaving a full-time position to concentrate on addressing his problems.
abstract: Tawana Gilbert of Queens receives help from Children's Aid Society in order to pay utility bills and buy clothes for her son, who struggles with drug addiction; society is one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Worried that her teenage son was slipping into drug addiction, Tawana Gilbert created a financial hardship for her family by leaving a full-time position to concentrate on addressing his problems.
